results.title: China: times of silk and gold (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Gill and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Professor William Watson, Professor of Chinese Art and Archaeology at the University of London, and Magnus Magnusson continue their journey across modern China, visiting one of the world’s great Buddhist shrines; the caves at Lyang; Sian, the ancient capital; and the tomb of a T’ang princess who died in 701 AD In the Forbidden City of Kubblah Khan in Peking, a remarkable clock is discovered - a present to the Emperor from Britain’s first trade mission in the 18th century.
results.description: Professor William Watson, Professor of Chinese Art and Archaeology at the University of London, and Magnus Magnusson continue their journey across modern China, visiting one of the world’s great Buddhist shrines; the caves at Lyang; Sian, the ancient capital; and the tomb of a T’ang princess who died in 701 AD In the Forbidden City of Kubblah Khan in Peking, a remarkable clock is discovered - a present to the Emperor from Britain’s first trade mission in the 18th century.

results.title: China: times of jade and bronze (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Gill and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1973 an exhibition of Chinese art was presented at the Royal Academy in London. Many of the prize pieces appear in this film, which evolves into an extensive journey through modern China to visit many of the sites from which the treasures came, putting them into the context of place and history. With William Watson and Magnus Magnusson. Museum sequences directed by Ray Sutcliffe, photographed by Phil Meheux.

results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Shows a glimpse of China’s many novel arts and crafts including the Cishou Kilns where much of China’s pottery is made; cork pictures; hair embroidery; root sculpture; stone pictures.

results.title: China today. No. 8205
results.creator_credit: Film Studio of the Peoples Republic of China
results.brief_description: Shows various aspects of China. An ancient city - Logang - showing its history and development. Adopting new techniques and building new high voltage power lines and towers. Working a new power shovel - sewage treatment. A family reunion - a man returning to the mainland of china. A new Archbishop is ordained in the Christian faith. The filming of “Midnight” a motion film.

results.title: China today. No. 8101
results.creator_credit: Central Newsreel and Documentary Film Studio of the People's Republic of China
results.brief_description: Chinese cinemagazine items: 1. Uses of remote sensing - Talks about China’s use of remote sensing to detect targets on the forest floor. 2. Reform school - Shows footage of a reform school full of juvenile delinquents whose crimes were not bad enough for jail. 3. Ancient ape fossil - Archeologists show us ape fossils from hundreds of years ago, which show the transition from ape to humans. 4. Stereotaxic brain apparatus - Shows the equipment helping neuro surgeons in treating patients with Parkinson Disease. 5. Wool-knitting - Shows the many patterns and items of clothing a pair of knitting needles can produce. 6. Quanqzhou Foreign Trade Center - Shows footage of the Center’s show-room for China’s export commodities.

results.title: China today. No. 804
results.creator_credit: Film Studio of the Peoples Republic of China
results.brief_description: Birthday banquet for old friend Dutch filmmaker John Ibens celebrates his 81st birthday through the Chinese Ministry Culture. “Ping Pong at the seashore” A training seminar for up coming ping-pong championships. “New job opportunities for urban youth” 1200 workers have been employed at the news sheet factory in Shanghai. “New method for processing metals” A new way of processing metals through controlled explosion. “Lashau Botanical Garden” A garden laboratory that looks at the study of new plant life and the domestication of wild plants. More than 3400 plants are cultivated at the Lashau garden.
